message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.CV 

This paper is about simultaneous translation, which is a subfield of natural language processing (NLP) and machine translation (MT). Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper proposes a supervised-learning framework to learn an adaptive policy, which involves training a model to make decisions based on available information. This suggests that the paper could also belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) or cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper mentions using a neural machine translation (NMT) model, which falls under cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper includes experiments on German-English translation, which could also place it in the subfield of computer vision (cs.CV) if the translation involves image or video data.
